definition: lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
to take part in
and/to give/together with
variant of 歟|欤[yu2]
bear/(coll.) to scold/to rebuke/(coll.) weak/incapable
surname Xiong
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2

sentences.english: Part four is "Delima Between Fish and Bear"s Paw.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分为“鱼与熊掌之间”。

sentences.english: Mr Obama, it seems, wants it both ways.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马似乎想要鱼与熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: Yet, at the same time, the BIS wants to eat its cake and have it too.
sentences.chinese: 然而，国际清算银行其实是在希望能鱼与熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: In an equestrian community you get to have your cake and eat it too.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的马术社区，你可以鱼与熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: You can't have your cake and eat it, too.
sentences.chinese: 因为你不能鱼与熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: You know, you can't have one without the other in a way, you know.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，鱼与熊掌不可兼得。

sentences.english: Putin has already indicated that Kiev can’t pursue both goals.
sentences.chinese: 普京早就道明，基辅不能鱼与熊掌兼得。

sentences.english: I think not keep fish and bear's paw , which must make a choice.
sentences.chinese: 我想，鱼与熊掌不可兼得，这必须作出选择。

sentences.english: You can't have it both ways. You must decide on one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 鱼与熊掌两者不能兼得，你必须选择其一。

definition: lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2

definition: to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
there is no gain without a loss (idiom)/there is no such thing as a free meal
pinyin: you3 suo3 de2 bi4 you3 suo3 shi1

definition: to choose/to accept or reject
to attend simultaneously to two or more things/to balance (career and family, family and education etc)
dilemma/quandary/to face a difficult choice
to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2

definition: (idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
to choose (literary)
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: to give up/to part with
easily obtained/readily available
either this or that/one or the other
after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
dilemma/quandary/Scylla and Charybdis/between the devil and the deep blue sea (idiom)
